newsitem.title: CHINA: China flooding kills at least 85 people.
newsitem.headline: China flooding kills at least 85 people.

text.p: Devastating floods caused by torrential rain across much of southern and eastern China have killed at least 85 people this month, state media and officials said on Friday.
Flooding in the southern region of Guangxi killed at least 34 people, injured 115 and destroyed some 11,000 houses since July 3, the China News Service said.

Worst hit were Wuzhou, Cangwu and Du'an, where the floods ruined about 170,000 hectares (420,000 acres) of crop, drowned more than 1,500 head of cattle and destroyed more than 90,000 tonnes of grain, the agency said.
Direct economic losses were estimated at about 1.4 billion yuan ($169 million) so far, an official in the regional flood control headquarters said by telephone.
In eastern Zhejiang province, floods killed at least 10 people and affected 5.14 million people, the Shanghai-based Wen Hui Bao newspaper said.
More than 80,000 houses were destroyed and 400,000 hectares (988,000 acres) of farmland were hit by floods, it said. Direct damage was estimated at three billion yuan.
Deadly high waters had killed at least 41 people by Thursday in southern Guangdong province and affected million residents, including tens of thousands who were left homeless, officials have said.
